title: Santos posts record output
text:
Santos has posted record production in the September quarter and forecast a further reduction in its breakeven oil price once its $2.2 billion deal to acquire ConocoPhillips' northern Australian business goes through.

Output rose 32 per cent from the year-earlier quarter to 19.8 million barrels of oil equivalent, which was also 7 per cent higher than the three months to June. Sales revenues were the second-highest on record, at $US1.03 billion ($1.53 billion).

JPMorgan analyst Mark Busuttil said the results highlighted the growth in production across Santos's portfolio, with gas and LNG performing better than expected, offsetting declines in condensates and crude oil production.

Santos is keen to develop the Dorado discovery made off the Western Australian coast last year. Supplied

He said sales were only marginally ahead of its estimate due to commodity prices, while RBC Capital Markets analyst Ben Wilson said revenues were 2 per cent shy of his estimate despite higher-than-expected volumes sold because the mix was skewed more towards Western Australian domestic gas where prices are weak.

Chief executive Kevin Gallagher described the quarter as another "strong" one for the company, generating $US214 million in free cash flow.
description: The oil and gas producer has signaled it is keen to go ahead with the Dorado oil project in Western Australia after drilling success in the September quarter.
